newsitem.title: JAPAN: KDD aims for 20 bln yen overseas revenues by 2000.
newsitem.headline: KDD aims for 20 bln yen overseas revenues by 2000.

text.p: Kokusai Denshin Denwa Co Ltd (KDD) president Tadashi Nishimoto said on Thursday the company aims for 20 billion yen in annual revenues from its telecommunication business in the European and U.S. markets by 2000.
KDD also said it has been granted an International Simple Resale (ISR) licence in Britain allowing the company to buy lines from British Telecommunications Plc and other carriers at wholesale rates.
KDD plans to apply for such a licence in Germany and France as well.
Nishimoto said the firm aims to boost revenues in the European and U.S. markets through the resale of international lines and fax and phone services.
